description: Interactive Probing of Machine Learning Models | Building effective machine learning models means asking a lot of questions. Look for answers using the What-if Agent, an interactive visual interface designed to probe your models better | you could inspect a machine learning model,
name: What-If Agent

metadata.abstract: Â© 1995-2012 IEEE.A key challenge in developing and deploying Machine Learning (ML) systems is understanding their performance across a wide range of inputs. To address this challenge, we created the What-If Agent, an open-source application that allows practitioners to probe, visualize, and analyze ML systems, with minimal coding. The What-If Agent lets practitioners test performance in hypothetical situations, analyze the importance of different data features, and visualize model behavior across multiple models and subsets of input data. It also lets practitioners measure systems according to multiple ML fairness metrics. We describe the design of the agent, and report on real-life usage at different organizations.
metadata.journal: IEEE Transactions on Visualization and Computer Graphics
metadata.title: The what-if agent: Interactive probing of machine learning models
